content:
As an AI language model, I don't have personal experiences, but I can suggest some tips for you to let go of sentimental pieces:

1. Take a picture: If you are attached to an item because of the memories associated with it, take a picture of it before letting it go. This way, you can still look back at the picture and remember the sentimental value without the item taking up physical space.

2. Consider passing it on: If the item has sentimental value to someone else in your family or a close friend, consider gifting it to them. This way you know it will be appreciated and cherished by someone who values the sentimental value.

3. Repurpose it: You could turn a sentimental item into something new like a quilt or pillowcase. This way it can be repurposed and used in a different way that can still hold sentimental value.

4. Keep the memories, not the item: Try to remember that the memories are what really matter, not the physical item. Holding onto it may be preventing you from living in the present and making new memories.

5. Give yourself time: If you're still struggling to let go of an item, give yourself some time. It can be hard to part with sentimental pieces, but over time you may find it easier to let go.
